title: Women Artists of Russias New Age, 1900-1935 (Art Ebook).pdf
description:
Women Artists of Russia's New Age, 1900-1935
Rizzoli | 1990 | ISBN: 0847810909 | English | 256 pages | PDF | 34.2 MB

The explosive outburst of artistic creativity that shook the foundations of Russian art from the turn of the century and continued up to the mid 1930s has increasingly become a subject of absorbing interest for Western readers. And of the many exciting aspects of the period, one of the most fascinating is the crucial role played by women. The creative individuality, boldness and stature of such avant-garde artists as Natalya Goncharova, Olga Rozanova, Alexandra Exter and Varvara Stepanova expanded the notion of the female artist far beyond traditional stereotypes, and in ways that makes their work particularly relevant today
